title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Wednesday, September 20 (game #604)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Nvidia 5000 series GPUs might use multi-chiplet design—and it could help get Nvidia back on the performance track
description: Nvidia is reportedly adopting a multi-chiplet design for its upcoming Nvidia Blackwell architecture, and it could be just what its RTX 5000 series needs to compete.

title: The new Fitbit app is rolling out now – here are the 5 biggest changes
description: New features for Fitbit include the ability to track steps without needing a wearable and access to a library of workouts.

title: Exclusive: Samsung Portable T9 SSD appears online ahead of impending release
description: World’s most popular portable SSD range could get a new flagship just in time for Black Friday.

title: Thousands of Juniper firewalls are open to serious attack
description: A patch has been available for a month, but many firms haven't applied it yet.

title: B&W’s upgraded noise-cancelling headphones are here to take on the Sony WH-1000XM5
description: The new B&W Px7 S2e promise even better performance, plus four cool color options.

title: Photoshop rival’s free update is a game-changer for VFX and 3D artists
description: Serif announces big free update to its creative software apps, including improved support for VFX, film, and 3D artists.

title: Intel unveils 288-core Leviathan 5th-gen Xeon CPU — but there could be an even bigger beast coming
description: 144, 288 and more cores on the horizon but just remember that they’re single-threaded

title: New cryptojacking attacks target uncommon AWS instances
description: Hackers are mining cryptocurrencies on other people's endpoints, and making a pretty profit.

title: Tekken 8 closed beta kicks off next month with 19 playable characters
description: Tekken 8 is getting a closed beta test on PS5, Xbox Series X|S and PC next month - prospective players can register now.

title: Unity's Runtime Fee policy forces studios to push back with over 500 developers joining in protest
description: More than 500 developers have joined the protest against Unity's Runtime Fee policy.

title: Starfield delay was "disaster situation" that left a "huge hole" in Microsoft’s games lineup
description: Phil Spencer admitted that the Starfield delay was a bad situation for the company's Xbox Game Pass lineup.

title: Intel announces new Core Ultra CPU with AI processing engine coming in December
description: Intel announced its latest series of CPUs, the Intel Core Ultra, at Intel Innovations this week, giving a December release date.

title: Google Chrome teases full tracking protection tool to keep users protected
description: Chrome could soon be getting a dedicated ‘Tracking Protection’ menu to help users control cookies.

title: Microsoft Surface Laptop 6: everything we know so far about the rumored laptop
description: Despite the lack of rumors in months, Microsoft will most likely be debuting its Surface Laptop 6 during the Surface Event.

title: Google Bard update reveals a more powerful AI – but it might scare privacy purists
description: Bard AI now has the ability to poke about in your Gmail and Docs? What could go wrong…?

title: Generative AI startup Writer secures $100m in funding for new AI
description: Writer has caught the eye of investors, and has a range of features to cut through the competition.

title: Ooblets is releasing on Steam next month alongside a new Halloween update
description: Ooblets, which first released on PC exclusively via the Epic Games Store, is coming to Steam on October 5.

title: Zoom wants to make sure your contact center experience is as painless as possible
description: New AI tools built into Zoom for Contact Center customers promise huge efficiency boosts all round.

title: NordPass now supports passkeys on iPhone
description: With iOS 17, NordPass can finally manage passkeys on Apple's mobile devices.

title: Microsoft AI researchers leaked 38TB worth of private company data
description: Cybersecurity researchers found an unprotected Microsoft Azure database - luckily, no one seems to have found it before.

title: The Baldur's Gate 3 core cast will play their characters for a one-shot D&D session
description: The core cast of Baldur's Gate 3 will reunite for a special one-shot Dungeons & Dragons livestream this week.

title: Nintendo briefed Activision on the ‘NG Switch’ in 2022, internal email shows
description: An internal email thread has revealed that Activision was briefed on the next Nintendo Switch console late last year.

title: Chinese hackers are exploiting a new Linux backdoor to target national governments
description: Researchers claim Chinese group is running an espionage campaign, as they spot new backdoor versions in active development.

title: Google Slides presentations are about to get more manic with multiple pointers
description: You can now know exactly where a colleague is in a Google Slides deck by tracking their pointer in real-time.

title: Next Xbox console targeting 2028 release, according to Microsoft court documents
description: Microsoft court documents from the FTC v. Microsoft case show plans to release the next Xbox console in 2028.

title: Netflix's next big movie is a crime thriller with 98% on Rotten Tomatoes
description: Netflix's new noir comic thriller got rave reviews at the Venice Film Festival as "one of the most entertaining movies of the year" – and incredibly, it's based on a true story

title: Xbox boss Phil Spencer was interested in acquiring Nintendo in 2020, internal email reveals
description: In a 2020 internal email, Xbox boss Phil Spencer said he was "fully supportive" of the idea of acquiring Nintendo if an opportunity arose.

title: Motorola's three new phones make the Pixel 7a look overpriced
description: Motorola dropped three colorful new phones with big screens and small prices this week.

title: Nokia unveils AI tools to boost mobile operators
description: New Nokia tool should boost AI and machine learning app development for telecommunications operators.

title: A whole load more AI could be coming to Microsoft Teams
description: Microsoft Teams AI library will let developers add multiple functions to the software.

title: iPhone 16 Pro tipped to inherit the best new camera feature of the iPhone 15 Pro Max
description: Want a periscope zoom camera without the Max size? Wait for the iPhone 16 Pro.

title: The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra could be the most disappointing phone of 2024
description: The Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra might lack the 10x optical zoom of the Galaxy S23 Ultra.

title: Xbox Series X refresh detailed in Microsoft court case, likely coming in late 2024
description: An Xbox Series X console refresh was accidentally revealed during the FTC v Microsoft court case.

title: Windows 11 Paint app is set for its biggest upgrade ever
description: Microsoft has seriously big plans for Paint – and we’re impressed with what’s going on in testing right now.

title: Is your company able to handle more AI? Most of us don't think so
description: It’s not news that using AI in the workplace can save workers time, but it’s certainly clearer than ever.

title: Elemental brings the heat as it shatters The Little Mermaid's Disney Plus movie record
description: Pixar's latest feature film has set a new Disney Plus movie record just one week after it was broken by The Little Mermaid.

title: Oblivion and Fallout 3 remasters are planned, according to Microsoft court documents
description: Microsoft court documents show plans to remaster The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion and Fallout 3.

title: Baldur's Gate 3 PS5 crashes are being investigated by Larian, and there's a temporary workaround
description: Larian is investigating PS5 crashes during Baldur’s Gate 3, and a more permanent solution is in the works.

title: Spider-Man 2 will show Peter or Miles around the city when you’re not playing as them
description: Spider-Man 2 will show the character you're not playing as fighting crime in the city on their own, and you can join in.

title: About a quarter of Starfield players haven't even been to space yet
description: According to its Xbox achievements list, around 25% of Starfield players stayed on Vectera.

title: Dragon Age should have been "PC-centric" and mod-friendly, says former Bioware manager
description: Former Bioware manager Aaryn Flynn wishes that Dragon Age had been more modder-friendly like CRPG Neverwinter Nights.

title: Windows Photos could finally catch up to Apple Photos with these new features
description: Windows Photos gets an upgrade and now comes with background blur and live photos - finally!

title: The recently-teased OnePlus Pad Go could take cheap Android tablets to a new level
description: In addition to having a 2.4K resolution screen, the OnePlus Pad Go may help the company establish its hardware ecosystem.
